title: RBS employs psychologists to check Bo is user-friendly – and rich men over 40 are feeling a bit moody about it
text:
The Royal Bank of Scotland has hired psychologists to make sure its upcoming banking app doesn’t come across as “patronising” to customers, The Sunday Telegraph has learned.

The taxpayer-controlled lender is due to launch its new digital bank Bó next month to compete with fintech start-ups such as Monzo, Starling Bank and Revolut.

Sources said RBS has hired psychologists and behavioural experts to make sure the app, which is designed to help people save money, doesn’t come across as condescending to potential users.

Experts testing the app on different groups have so far found that one demographic - “rich men over 40” - do not like using it, one person said.
